ANU.name: Katrina Roper
interest: * Infectious diseases and outbreak response* Workforce development and epidemiology training programs* Laboratory strengthening, biosafety and biosecurity, deployable laboratory capacity* Civil-military interoperability in humanitarian response
ANU.biography: In my early academic career, I worked at James Cook University studying the crown-of-thorns starfish for my PhD research project and the viruses that affect aquacultured prawns for a three-year ARC-funded post-doctoral research fellowship.
project: Using new point-of-care tests to improve outbreak response to epidemic and emerging pandemic influenza. Co-investigator with Dr Sacha Stelzer-Braid, UNSW. Funded by Integrated Systems for Epidemic Response Seed Funding.
